title: Sell Taketsuru Pure Malt
metaTitle: Sell Taketsuru Pure Malt | 17, 21, 25 Year | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: Sell your Taketsuru whisky. We buy the discontinued 17, 21, and 25 Year Old Pure Malts. Get a direct quote.
heroSubhead: Direct purchase of Taketsuru 17, 21, and 25 Year Old Pure Malts.
introParagraph: Named after the father of Japanese whisky, Masataka Taketsuru, this pure malt series is iconic. The age-statement bottles are famously scarce.
whatWeDoNotBuy: Taketsuru NAS (White Label) - Current Release (unless bulk)
conditionFactors: Label Style: Differentiating between the old 'Black Label' NAS and the new 'White Label' NAS
Box: 21 and 25 year presentation boxes are heavy and specific
Seal: Check for cracks in the black plastic seal
Fill Level: Into neck is standard
pricingFactors: Age: 25 Year is the peak, followed by 21. 17 is the entry-level investment grade.
Awards: Taketsuru 21 won 'World's Best Blended Malt' multiple times, driving price.
Label Version: Older bottlings (pre-2015) may carry a slight premium.

faqs.question: Why did they discontinue the 17/21?
faqs.answer: Shortage of aged stock. They simply ran out of old whisky.

faqs.question: Is my NAS bottle worth anything?
faqs.answer: The black label NAS (old style) is worth slightly more than the current white label, but far less than the 17yr.

faqs.question: Do you buy the 35 Year Old?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is an ultra-premium bottle. We require inspection.

faqs.question: Do I need the box?
faqs.answer: For 21 and 25 year, yes. For 17 year, it is preferred but not mandatory.

faqs.question: What is 'Pure Malt'?
faqs.answer: It means a blend of single malts (no grain whisky) from Nikka's two distilleries: Yoichi and Miyagikyo.

faqs.question: How do I ship it?
faqs.answer: Securely in a strong box. We provide the label.
